Understanding RESTOR+ and REXO Therapies

RESTOR+ is a natural tissue allograft derived from umbilical cord Wharton's Jelly, containing growth factors and supportive matrix that may help supplement damaged tissues. REXO is a concentrated exosome therapy utilizing cellular messengers that may help reduce inflammation and encourage tissue repair.

üß¨

Wharton's Jelly Allograft

Young, potent cellular material from healthy birthing tissues, rigorously tested for safety and quality

üíâ

Growth Factors & Matrix

Natural proteins and cushioning material that may support your body's repair processes

üî¨

Exosome Technology

Extracellular vesicles that facilitate cell-to-cell communication and may help reduce inflammation

2:34

Dr. Fura explains these investigational therapies and the evaluation process

What the Research Shows:

In clinical studies, some patients receiving Wharton's Jelly injections for knee arthritis reported pain reduction and improved mobility. One case report documented 50% pain reduction at 3 months post-treatment. However, these are early findings and more research is needed. Results vary significantly between individuals.

Conditions We Evaluate for Treatment

Not all patients are candidates. Thorough evaluation determines eligibility.

Joint Conditions

  • Moderate knee arthritis
  • Hip degeneration
  • Shoulder injuries
  • Ankle & wrist pain

Spine & Back

  • Degenerative disc disease
  • Facet joint syndrome
  • Spinal arthritis
  • SI joint dysfunction

Nerve Issues

  • Peripheral neuropathy
  • Nerve inflammation
  • Chronic pain syndromes
  • Post-injury nerve pain

Soft Tissue

  • Partial tendon tears
  • Ligament injuries
  • Chronic tendinitis
  • Sports injuries

Not recommended for: Active infections, certain blood disorders, active cancer, or severe medical conditions. Full medical evaluation required.

Frequently Asked Questions

Are these treatments FDA-approved?

No. RESTOR+ and REXO are investigational therapies not approved by the FDA for pain indications. They are offered under Florida law HB 1617 for orthopedic and pain management conditions. The products are processed in FDA-registered laboratories.

What are the success rates?

Results vary significantly between individuals. While some patients report substantial improvement, others may see minimal change. We cannot guarantee specific outcomes. Dr. Fura will provide realistic expectations based on your condition and available research.

How many treatments will I need?

Treatment plans are individualized. Many patients receive 1-2 treatments, but this varies based on condition severity and response. Some may benefit from maintenance treatments. This will be discussed during your evaluation.

Is this covered by insurance?

Most insurance plans do not cover investigational therapies. Consultation and evaluation may be covered. We offer payment plans and accept HSA/FSA funds. Financial options will be discussed before any treatment.

What's the recovery time?

Most patients experience mild soreness for 24-48 hours and can return to daily activities within a few days. We provide specific post-procedure guidelines. Improvement, if it occurs, may be gradual over weeks to months.

What are the risks?

Common side effects include temporary soreness, swelling, or bruising at the injection site. Serious complications are rare but possible. All risks will be thoroughly discussed during the informed consent process as required by law.

Ready to Explore Your Options?

Important Medical Disclaimer

RESTOR+ and REXO therapies are INVESTIGATIONAL treatments NOT approved by the FDA for pain indications. They are offered under Florida law HB 1617 (2025) for orthopedics and pain management. No guaranteed outcomes ‚Äì efficacy is not assured and is based on early research. Individual results vary significantly.

Products are ethically sourced from healthy birthing tissues (no fetal tissue or embryos involved) and processed in FDA-registered laboratories under strict quality controls. This website and its contents comply with Florida HB 1617 marketing requirements and FDA guidelines regarding regenerative medicine products.
